title: Name and Territory of the Union
text: India, that is Bharat, shall be a Union of States.

title: Admission or Establishment of New States
text: Parliament may by law admit into the Union or establish new States.

title: Formation of New States and Alteration of Areas
text: Parliament may by law form new States, alter their boundaries or names.

title: Laws Made Under Articles 2 and 3
text: Laws under Articles 2 and 3 shall include necessary amendments to schedules.

title: Citizenship at the Commencement of the Constitution
text: Citizenship rights shall apply to persons domiciled in India at commencement.

title: Rights of Citizenship of Persons Who Migrated from Pakistan
text: Citizenship criteria for people migrating from Pakistan to India.

title: Rights of Citizenship of Persons Who Migrated to Pakistan
text: Citizenship of persons who migrated to Pakistan after March 1, 1947.

title: Rights of Citizenship of Persons of Indian Origin Residing Outside India
text: Citizenship rights for persons of Indian origin living abroad.

title: Persons Voluntarily Acquiring Foreign Citizenship
text: Persons acquiring foreign citizenship shall not be citizens of India.

title: Continuance of Citizenship
text: Continuance of the rights of citizenship.

title: Parliament to Regulate Citizenship
text: Parliament has power to make laws regarding citizenship.

title: Definition of the State
text: Definition of State for the purpose of Fundamental Rights.

title: Laws Inconsistent with Fundamental Rights
text: Any law inconsistent with Fundamental Rights shall be void.

title: Right to Equality
text: The State shall not deny any person equality before the law.

title: Prohibition of Discrimination
text: State shall not discriminate based on religion, race, caste, sex or place of birth.

title: Equality of Opportunity in Public Employment
text: Equal employment opportunities in public offices.

title: Abolition of Untouchability
text: Untouchability is abolished; its practice is an offence.

title: Abolition of Titles
text: State shall not confer titles except military or academic distinctions.

title: Right to Freedom
text: Freedom of speech, movement, assembly, residence, profession and association.

title: Protection in Respect of Conviction for Offences
text: Protection against ex post facto laws, double jeopardy and self-incrimination.
